original: @125a * // he ru ka'i rnam par dag pa bzhugs /
analyzed: @125a * // he ru ka'i rnam par dag pa bzhugs /
translated: The pure state of Heruka is present.

original: # // bcom ldan 'das 'jam pa'i rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: # // bcom ldan 'das 'jam pa'i rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed One, Ma√±juvajra.

original: bcom ldan rje btsun dpal he ru ka'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan rje btsun dpal he ru ka'i rnam par dag pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: The pure state of the Blessed Lord, glorious Heruka, is taught.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: It has the nature of the pure state of right concentration.

original: yang dag pa ni phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ni phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: Right is non-erroneous,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not shared in common with the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so forth.

original: sems so sor rig pa la sogs pa zla ba dang / rdo rje'i rnam pa dang / rigs lnga dang / phung po gcig gis rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems so sor rig pa la sogs pa zla ba dang / rdo rje'i rnam pa dang / rigs lnga dang / phung po gcig gis rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The mind is the nature of the moon, the vajra form, the five families, and the single aggregate consciousness, because it is the nature of the five aggregates.

original: de nyid ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa yin la /
analyzed: de nyid ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa yin la /
translated: That itself is the stage of devoted engagement.

original: mos pa ni lhag par mos pas te /
analyzed: mos pa ni lhag par mos pas te /
translated: Devoted means devoted interest.

original: khyad par can gyis lha'i rnam par bsgom pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos ma lus pa ro gcig pa'i bdag nyid can gyi spyod pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par can gyis lha'i rnam par bsgom pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos ma lus pa ro gcig pa'i bdag nyid can gyi spyod pa ni /
translated: The conduct of the bodhisattva who cultivates the form of the deity with special devotion is the nature of the single taste of all the factors of enlightenment.

original: ma rig pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is the antidote to ignorance.

original: yang na dngos po so so'i rnam par dag pa gzhan dang gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na dngos po so so'i rnam par dag pa gzhan dang gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Or else, the individual purities of the entities are not different.

original: zhal bzhi ni dga' ba bzhi'i rang bzhin can te /
analyzed: zhal bzhi ni dga' ba bzhi'i rang bzhin can te /
translated: The four faces are the nature of the four joys,

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i dga' ba dang / stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i khyad par can gyi 'bras bu'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i dga' ba dang / stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i khyad par can gyi 'bras bu'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the nature of the result that is distinguished by the doors of liberation, such as emptiness, and so on, which arise from the contact of the union of the four great elements.

original: de la phyag bcu gnyis kyi dang pos da ma ru ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de la phyag bcu gnyis kyi dang pos da ma ru ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: Among them, the first of the twelve hands holds a ·∏çamaru, which is the purity of the perfection of generosity,

original: 'di ltar rang dang gzhan dbyer med pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam pa rtag tu chos kyi sgra nyan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang dang gzhan dbyer med pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam pa rtag tu chos kyi sgra nyan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one always hears the sound of Dharma in the aspect of the ma·πá·∏çala wheel of the inseparability of oneself and others.

original: ser sna dang gzhan gyi bde ba 'phrog pa'i gnyen po @125b yin no //
analyzed: ser sna dang gzhan gyi bde ba 'phrog pa'i gnyen po @125b yin no //
translated: It is the antidote to stinginess and the stealing of others‚Äô happiness.

original: de nyid ni sa rab tu dga' ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni sa rab tu dga' ba ste /
translated: That is the bh≈´mi Very Joyful.

original: bdag dang gzhan dbyer med pa'i bde ba chen po'i dga' ba de skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dbyer med pa'i bde ba chen po'i dga' ba de skyed par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of the joy of great bliss, which is the non-differentiation of self and other.

original: dgra sta ni tshul khrims kyi shel dag pa dang 'dra bar dag pa yin te /
analyzed: dgra sta ni tshul khrims kyi shel dag pa dang 'dra bar dag pa yin te /
translated: The hatchet is purity, like the purity of the crystal of morality.

original: 'di ltar srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba dang / bza' bar bya ba'i dam tshig las 'das pa la sogs pa 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyis 'dus byas gcod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba dang / bza' bar bya ba'i dam tshig las 'das pa la sogs pa 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyis 'dus byas gcod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it cuts off the compounded, by means of the immorality of killing, etc., and the transgression of the vow of what is to be eaten, etc.

original: de nyid ni sa dri ma med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni sa dri ma med pa ste /
translated: It is the stainless stage,

original: sdig pa thams cad las ldog par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad las ldog par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the turning away from all evil.

original: gri gug ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: gri gug ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The curved knife is the purification of the perfection of patience,

original: pha rol kun nas 'khrug pas mtshon dang dbyig pa dang / phag dum la sogs pas bsnun pas rnam par shes pa 'khrug cing mi bzod pa kun nas gcod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol kun nas 'khrug pas mtshon dang dbyig pa dang / phag dum la sogs pas bsnun pas rnam par shes pa 'khrug cing mi bzod pa kun nas gcod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it cuts off the impatience of the disturbance of consciousness by the blows of weapons, sticks, clods, etc., of the disturbance of others.

original: de nyid ni sa 'od byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni sa 'od byed pa yin te /
translated: That is the stage of the Luminous,

original: mi 'khrugs pas sems la gnas shing /
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pas sems la gnas shing /
translated: because one abides in the mind that is unshakable.

original: gnas pas mi shes pa rnam par 'jig la /
analyzed: gnas pas mi shes pa rnam par 'jig la /
translated: By abiding, one destroys ignorance,

original: de med pas ye shes rnyogs pa med pa rab tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de med pas ye shes rnyogs pa med pa rab tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and because of that, one illuminates the stainless pristine wisdom.

original: rtse gsum pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: rtse gsum pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: The three peaks are the purification of the perfection of effort.

original: snyom las dang le lo dang brtson 'grus med pa dang / spro ba med pas lam ma yin pa la rjes su spyod pa'i phyir ngan 'gro ngan song dmyal ba la sogs pa'i ming dang gzugs 'byung ba de'i gnyen po lus dang ngag dang yid mkhyen pa'i rtse gsum rnon po'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: snyom las dang le lo dang brtson 'grus med pa dang / spro ba med pas lam ma yin pa la rjes su spyod pa'i phyir ngan 'gro ngan song dmyal ba la sogs pa'i ming dang gzugs 'byung ba de'i gnyen po lus dang ngag dang yid mkhyen pa'i rtse gsum rnon po'i rang bzhin /
translated: Because of laziness, indolence, lack of effort, and lack of enthusiasm, one follows a path that is not the path, and so the name and form of the bad destinies, the lower realms, the hells, and so on, arise. The antidote to that is the three sharp peaks of body, speech, and mind,

original: bde bar gshegs pa skul bar byed pa'i brtson 'grus kyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa skul bar byed pa'i brtson 'grus kyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: which have the nature of the effort that urges on the Sugatas.

original: de nyid ni sa 'od 'phro ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni sa 'od 'phro ba yin te /
translated: That is the stage of the Radiant,

original: 'od ni 'od zer te /
analyzed: 'od ni 'od zer te /
translated: because light is light rays.

original: ye shes rnam par 'phro ba'i blo'i khyad par shes rab kyi mthu gang gis bde bar gshegs pa nyid du 'gyur ba zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ye shes rnam par 'phro ba'i blo'i khyad par shes rab kyi mthu gang gis bde bar gshegs pa nyid du 'gyur ba zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The special knowledge of the light of wisdom is the power of wisdom, by which one becomes a sugata.

original: kha tv'am ga ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: kha tv'am ga ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the purification of the perfection of meditation.

original: 'di ltar bsam gtan rtse gcig pas skye mched drug gis rnam bar g-yeng ba spangs pas /üîΩphung po la sogs pa ma lus pa'i mgo bo nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gtan rtse gcig pas skye mched drug gis rnam bar g-yeng ba spangs pas / phung po la sogs pa ma lus pa'i mgo bo nas brtsams te /
translated: Thus, by means of onepointed meditation, one abandons the distraction of the six sense media.üîΩBeginning with the head and ending with the feet,

original: rkang pa'i mthar thug rnam par bcad na /
analyzed: rkang pa'i mthar thug rnam par bcad na /
translated: one cuts up the body into pieces.

original: nang stong pa nyid du ro gcig cing g-yo ba med pa nyid ni dung dang / kunda dang / zla ba dang / shel dag pa dang 'dra ba yin te /üîΩsems kyi rang bzhin du gyur @126a * //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid du ro gcig cing g-yo ba med pa nyid ni dung dang / kunda dang / zla ba dang / shel dag pa dang 'dra ba yin te / sems kyi rang bzhin du gyur @126a * //
translated: The inner emptiness is of one taste and is unmoving, like a conch, a jasmine flower, the moon, and a pure crystal.

original: pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the nature of mind.

original: de nyid ni sa rab tu sbyang dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni sa rab tu sbyang dka' ba yin te /
translated: This is the difficult ground,

original: rab tu ste nges par mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdud kyis thub par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu ste nges par mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdud kyis thub par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is difficult for the devil Mara to disturb the mind, which is well concentrated and onepointed.

original: dril bu ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: dril bu ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The bell is the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ltar shes rab ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang ngag gi tha snyad la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang ngag gi tha snyad la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin te /
translated: Thus, wisdom is the antidote to immorality, verbal conventions, and so on.

original: chos kyi gsung rin po che'i sgra snyan pa skye ba med pa'i sgyor bas /
analyzed: chos kyi gsung rin po che'i sgra snyan pa skye ba med pa'i sgyor bas /
translated: By the sweet sound of the precious Dharma speech, the illusion of non-arising,

original: 'gro ba yang dag par ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba yang dag par ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it causes the world to be truly shown.

original: de ni sa mngon du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni sa mngon du gyur pa yin te /
translated: That is the stage of manifest.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra mngon du gyur pas brjod pa ni ldog pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra mngon du gyur pas brjod pa ni ldog pa med pa yin te /
translated: The sound of all dharmas being unborn becomes manifest, and the expression is irreversible.

original: chos nyid des rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'bras bur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos nyid des rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'bras bur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By that reality, it becomes the result of omniscience.

original: rdo rje ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa yin te //
analyzed: rdo rje ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa yin te //
translated: The vajra is the perfection of method.

original: gang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa la nye bar spyod cing nan tan du byed pa de ni thabs yin te /
analyzed: gang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa la nye bar spyod cing nan tan du byed pa de ni thabs yin te /
translated: That by which one practices and engages in generosity and so on is the method.

original: ser sna la sogs pa thabs ma yin pa'i gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa thabs ma yin pa'i gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the antidotes to stinginess and so on, which are not the means.

original: de'i 'bras bur gyur pa ni grangs ji lta ba bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa lnga rang bzhin gcig zab pa dang rgya che ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bur gyur pa ni grangs ji lta ba bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa lnga rang bzhin gcig zab pa dang rgya che ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result of those is the five beginning with the mirror-like wisdom, which are of one nature, because they are the nature of the profound and the vast.

original: de nyid ni sa ring du song ba yin te //
analyzed: de nyid ni sa ring du song ba yin te //
translated: That is the ground Gone Afar,

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar stong pa nyid dang snying rje chen po dbyer med pa'i lam gyi sgo nas shin tu bde ba la sogs pa myong ba las des sems can thams cad skad cig ma gcig gis ring du song bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar stong pa nyid dang snying rje chen po dbyer med pa'i lam gyi sgo nas shin tu bde ba la sogs pa myong ba las des sems can thams cad skad cig ma gcig gis ring du song bar byed pa ste /
translated: because in that way, by the path of the inseparability of emptiness and great compassion, one experiences the bliss of the supreme and so on, and by that, all sentient beings are caused to go afar in one instant.

original: thob par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thob par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is to say, they are caused to attain.

original: padma'i snod ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: padma'i snod ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: The vessel of the lotus is the pure perfection of aspiration,

original: 'di ltar dang po sems bskyed pa'i dus su /
analyzed: 'di ltar dang po sems bskyed pa'i dus su /
translated: because at the time of first generating the mind of enlightenment,

original: bdag dpal he ru kar gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas dam bcas pa'i smon lam yin te /
analyzed: bdag dpal he ru kar gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas dam bcas pa'i smon lam yin te /
translated: The vow is the aspiration, May I become glorious Heruka! and so forth.

original: sems can gyi don la bab pa smon lam gyi rgyan gyis nye bar brgyan pa ni /üîΩsmon lam ma yin pa'i shes pa'i rtsa ba can 'khor bar 'byin par byed pa'i sred ba de'i gnyen por gyur pas /
analyzed: sems can gyi don la bab pa smon lam gyi rgyan gyis nye bar brgyan pa ni / smon lam ma yin pa'i shes pa'i rtsa ba can 'khor bar 'byin par byed pa'i sred ba de'i gnyen por gyur pas /
translated: The ornament of the vow is the adornment with the vow to benefit sentient beings.

original: ye shes kyi bdud rtsis nang kun nas bkang ba can mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi bdud rtsis nang kun nas bkang ba can mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is the antidote to craving, which is the root of the consciousness that is not a vow, and which causes one to be born in cyclic existence, it is filled with the nectar of wisdom because it is desired.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don la dbye ba med pa rgyun mi 'chad pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don la dbye ba med pa rgyun mi 'chad pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is uninterrupted because it is applied to the benefit of self and other without interruption.

original: de nyid ni sa mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid ni sa mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of the stage called Immovable.

original: zhags pa @126b ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: zhags pa @126b ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: The lasso is the purification of the perfection of power.

original: 'di ltar stobs dang mthu dang nus pa ma tshang ba med pas kun du rtog pa'i nye bar len pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar stobs dang mthu dang nus pa ma tshang ba med pas kun du rtog pa'i nye bar len pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the antidote to the appropriation of conceptualization because it is complete with power, strength, and ability.

original: tshul bzhin g-yo ba med pa'i chos la 'jug pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / kun nas dbang du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin g-yo ba med pa'i chos la 'jug pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / kun nas dbang du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the stage of Good Intelligence, because it is the entry into the Dharma of the unmoving, uninterrupted, and all-controlling.

original: de nyid ni sa legs pa'i blo gros yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni sa legs pa'i blo gros yin te /
translated: That is the stage of Good Intelligence.

original: legs pa'i blo gros ni dge ba'i blo ste /
analyzed: legs pa'i blo gros ni dge ba'i blo ste /
translated: Good Intelligence is the intelligence of virtue,

original: rnam par rtog pa 'dzin pa gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'dzin pa gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it cuts off the grasping of conceptualization.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje phag mo ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje phag mo ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One, Vajravarahi, is the purity of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa mtshon bya dang / mtshon byed dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes lhun gyis grub pa mtshon bya dang / mtshon byed dang bral ba /
translated: Thus, the spontaneous wisdom of omniscience is free from the indicated and the indicator,

original: brjod pa med par ro gcig pa'i dga' ba bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin can bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i mi shes pa dang / dngos por 'dzin pa'i gnyen pos snang ba med par byed par bzod pa /
analyzed: brjod pa med par ro gcig pa'i dga' ba bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin can bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i mi shes pa dang / dngos por 'dzin pa'i gnyen pos snang ba med par byed par bzod pa /
translated: and is the nature of the great bliss of the single taste of inexpressible joy. It is the patience that makes the non-apprehension of the apprehender and the apprehended, which is the antidote to the ignorance of the apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù and the apprehension of substantiality, appear.

original: bying ba dang / rgod pa'i phyogs gnyis ka yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: bying ba dang / rgod pa'i phyogs gnyis ka yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: It is the complete elimination of both the side of depression and the side of agitation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag gcod par byed pas te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag gcod par byed pas te /
translated: Therefore, they are the cutter,

original: gri gug yin la /
analyzed: gri gug yin la /
translated: the flaying knife.

original: de gnyis ka mnyam pa nyid kyi ro myang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de gnyis ka mnyam pa nyid kyi ro myang ba'i phyir //
translated: Since both of them experience the taste of equality,

original: khrag gis yongs su bkang ba'i snod yin no //
analyzed: khrag gis yongs su bkang ba'i snod yin no //
translated: they are the vessel filled with blood.

original: de nyid ni sa chos kyi sprin yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni sa chos kyi sprin yin te /
translated: That is the stage Cloud of Dharma,

original: 'di ltar spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi chos nyid ni sprin yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi chos nyid ni sprin yin te /
translated: because the reality that is the nature of non-elaboration is a cloud.

original: sprin dang 'dra bar rang bzhin gyi chu'i rgyun gyis rlan par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sprin dang 'dra bar rang bzhin gyi chu'i rgyun gyis rlan par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Like a cloud, it is moistened by the stream of natural water,

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa tshim par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa tshim par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: and it satisfies the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: tshangs pa'i mgo bo ni phung po'i bdud kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i mgo bo ni phung po'i bdud kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The head of Brahma is the nature of the demon of the aggregates,üîΩbecause the body of the three realms, which has the nature of the five aggregates, is generated by the head of Brahma.

original: 'di ltar khams gsum pa phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi lus de skyed par byed pa tshangs pa'i ngar 'dzin pa can log par smra ba de nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i bdud las skyes pa'i rmongs pa de la /
analyzed: 'di ltar khams gsum pa phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi lus de skyed par byed pa tshangs pa'i ngar 'dzin pa can log par smra ba de nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i bdud las skyes pa'i rmongs pa de la /
translated: The ignorance that arises from the demon of the aggregates, such as form, is the demon of the aggregates.

original: rnam par shes pa ngar 'dzin pa'i nga rgyal gcod par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ngar 'dzin pa'i nga rgyal gcod par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: because it cuts off the pride of the grasping of consciousness as an ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: tshangs pa'i mgo gdong bzhi pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i mgo gdong bzhi pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it has the four faces of Brahma.

original: 'jigs byed ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: 'jigs byed ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: Bhairava is the nature of the demon of afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags kyi rtsa ba can yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags kyi rtsa ba can yin la /
translated: Afflictions have the root of desire.

original: 'dod chags ni dbang phyug chen po yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni dbang phyug chen po yin te /
translated: Desire is Mahesvara.

original: 'dod pas zhen pa'i 'dod pas spro ba dang bsdu ba'i nga rgyal can /
analyzed: 'dod pas zhen pa'i 'dod pas spro ba dang bsdu ba'i nga rgyal can /
translated: The pride of expansion and contraction through the desire of attachment to desire is the self that binds.

original: @127a * // bdag 'ching bar byed pa de nyid 'khor ba yin no //üîΩmnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa la sogs pas lus rgas pa /
analyzed: @127a * // bdag 'ching bar byed pa de nyid 'khor ba yin no // mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa la sogs pas lus rgas pa /
translated: That itself is samsara.üîΩThe body is aged, decrepit, and so on, through the equality and inequality of the elements.

original: rnying pa / smin ma dang sma ra la sogs pa 'jigs par byed pa'i bdag nyid /
analyzed: rnying pa / smin ma dang sma ra la sogs pa 'jigs par byed pa'i bdag nyid /
translated: The eyebrows, beard, and so on are the nature of fear.

original: ngag gi rang bzhin 'brug sgra la sogs pa sgrogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ngag gi rang bzhin 'brug sgra la sogs pa sgrogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Speech is the nature of the sound of thunder and so on.

original: de'i nga rgyal bzlog pa'i don du rol pas nges par ma bzung zhing 'bad rtsol med par g-yon pa'i zhabs kyis gan rkyal du mnan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i nga rgyal bzlog pa'i don du rol pas nges par ma bzung zhing 'bad rtsol med par g-yon pa'i zhabs kyis gan rkyal du mnan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In order to reverse the pride of that, he is not definitely grasped by the play, and with his left foot he lies on his back without effort.

original: dus mtshan ni 'chi bdag gi bdud kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: dus mtshan ni 'chi bdag gi bdud kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The ‚Äúnight‚Äù is the nature of the mƒÅra of the lord of death.

original: phung po rnam par 'jig cing stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: phung po rnam par 'jig cing stong pa nyid do //
translated: It is the disintegration of the aggregates and emptiness.üîΩThe ‚Äúdarkness‚Äù is the nature of the three times, past, future, and present, which is the profound nature of the phenomena of samsara, which are internal and external.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus gsum na yod pa'i phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi 'khor ba'i chos zab par byed pa'i bdag nyid can gcig tu mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin can khong khro ba'i sems kyi rgyun thams cad med pa /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus gsum na yod pa'i phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi 'khor ba'i chos zab par byed pa'i bdag nyid can gcig tu mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin can khong khro ba'i sems kyi rgyun thams cad med pa /
translated: The ‚Äúnight‚Äù is the nature of nirvana, which is the absence of all the continuums of the mind of anger.üîΩThe ‚Äúdarkness‚Äù is the ignorance of desire.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba mtshan mo mi shes pa mun pa de la zhabs g-yas pa reg pas bskyed pa'i bde ba chen po'i rnam pa'i ye shes nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba mtshan mo mi shes pa mun pa de la zhabs g-yas pa reg pas bskyed pa'i bde ba chen po'i rnam pa'i ye shes nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the ‚Äúnight‚Äù is touched with the right foot, the gnosis of the form of great bliss is definitely held.

original: 'dod chags chen po yang dag pa'i thabs yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po yang dag pa'i thabs yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the method of great passion.

original: glang po che'i pags pa ni lha'i bu'i bdud yin te /
analyzed: glang po che'i pags pa ni lha'i bu'i bdud yin te /
translated: The elephant skin is the mƒÅra of the son of the gods.

original: lha ni lha chen po'o //
analyzed: lha ni lha chen po'o //
translated: The god is Mahe≈õvara.

original: de'i bu ni de las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bu ni de las skyes pa'o //
translated: His son is born from him.

original: glang po chen po bgegs kyi dbang phyug ste /üîΩlog 'dren nyon mongs pa sgrib pa mun pa mun nag rmongs pa /
analyzed: glang po chen po bgegs kyi dbang phyug ste / log 'dren nyon mongs pa sgrib pa mun pa mun nag rmongs pa /
translated: The elephant is the lord of obstacles.üîΩThe wrong guide is the cause of the attainment of the wisdom of the vast and the hot, and it is the opposite of the obscurations of the afflictions, darkness, and delusion.

original: thab pa dang rgya che ba'i ye shes thob par byed pa'i rgyu dang 'gal bar byed pa de'i nyon mongs pa'i pags pa bshus te /
analyzed: thab pa dang rgya che ba'i ye shes thob par byed pa'i rgyu dang 'gal bar byed pa de'i nyon mongs pa'i pags pa bshus te /
translated: Having flayed the skin of the afflictions of that one,

original: phyag g-yas pa dang g-yon pa gnyis kyis gos bzhin du rgyal mtshan gyi bla mar phub pa dang 'dra bar kun nas bgegs med par bya ba dang / srid pa dang zhi ba gnyis kyis gdung ba gnyis su med pa'i ro gcig pa chen po'i grib ma bsil ba dang 'dra bar tshim par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa dang g-yon pa gnyis kyis gos bzhin du rgyal mtshan gyi bla mar phub pa dang 'dra bar kun nas bgegs med par bya ba dang / srid pa dang zhi ba gnyis kyis gdung ba gnyis su med pa'i ro gcig pa chen po'i grib ma bsil ba dang 'dra bar tshim par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The two sufferings of cyclic existence and nirvana are like the cool shade of a tree, which satisfies the two without the duality of the two.

original: de dag nyid ni sangs rgyas kyi sa bcu gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag nyid ni sangs rgyas kyi sa bcu gnyis pa yin te /
translated: These are the twelve stages of buddhahood.

original: 'di ltar bdud bzhi'i stobs dang ngar 'dzin bcom nas /üîΩshin tu rmongs pa chen po la sogs pa'i gnyen po sgom pa'i stobs rtogs pa las skyes pa phyag rgya chen po'i @127b 'dus te reg pa'i kun du bzang po ro gcig pa dang mtha' gnyis ka ma lus pa'i rnam pa'i ye shes dri ma med pa'i g-yo
analyzed: 'di ltar bdud bzhi'i stobs dang ngar 'dzin bcom nas / shin tu rmongs pa chen po la sogs pa'i gnyen po sgom pa'i stobs rtogs pa las skyes pa phyag rgya chen po'i @127b 'dus te reg pa'i kun du bzang po ro gcig pa dang mtha' gnyis ka ma lus pa'i rnam pa'i ye shes dri ma med pa'i g-yo
translated: Thus, having conquered the power of the four mƒÅras and the grasping of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù

original: ba med pa /
analyzed: ba med pa /
translated: the power of meditation on the antidotes to great delusion and so on arises from realization. The great seal is the all-good contact of the single taste of the stainless pristine consciousness of the aspect of the entirety of the two ends.

original: gnyis su med pa'i chos nyid kyi snying po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i chos nyid kyi snying po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term is the essence of the nondual reality.

original: stag gi pags pa ni zhi khro ba yin te /
analyzed: stag gi pags pa ni zhi khro ba yin te /
translated: The tiger skin is peaceful and wrathful.

original: yul drug la dgod pa dang / 'dod pa la chags pa dang / lus dang ngag dang sems cher 'khrugs pa las khro ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul drug la dgod pa dang / 'dod pa la chags pa dang / lus dang ngag dang sems cher 'khrugs pa las khro ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Anger arises from the six objects, attachment to desire, and great agitation of body, speech, and mind.

original: de nyid ni shin tu khro ba nyid kyi phyir dang / sna tshogs pa la mngon par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir /üîΩstag ni sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni shin tu khro ba nyid kyi phyir dang / sna tshogs pa la mngon par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir / stag ni sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: That itself is a tiger because of being very wrathful and desiring variety.

original: de las bshus nas mnabs pa ni tshangs par spyod pa la rjes su spyod pa'i ngang tshul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las bshus nas mnabs pa ni tshangs par spyod pa la rjes su spyod pa'i ngang tshul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having flayed it, he wears it because of his nature of practicing celibacy.

original: dbang po'i mdud pa'i kun nas dregs pa zhi bas khro ba med pa'i skad cig ma'i bdag nyid can no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbang po'i mdud pa'i kun nas dregs pa zhi bas khro ba med pa'i skad cig ma'i bdag nyid can no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he has the nature of a moment of non-anger due to the pacification of the arrogance of the knots of the sense faculties.

original: de nyid ni rdo rje las kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje las kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: That itself is the perfection of vajra action.

original: 'di ltar rdo rje 'dra bar dbyer med cing mi 'khrugs pa dbang po'i sgo nas bde ba chen po yid la byed pa'i las la mkhas pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdo rje 'dra bar dbyer med cing mi 'khrugs pa dbang po'i sgo nas bde ba chen po yid la byed pa'i las la mkhas pa /
translated: Thus, ‚Äúinseparable like a vajra‚Äù means that the great bliss that is the object of the sense faculties is not disturbed.

original: las ma yin pa'i gnyen po ye shes kyi spyod pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las ma yin pa'i gnyen po ye shes kyi spyod pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúSkilled in the activity of mental attention‚Äù means that the nature of the conduct of wisdom, which is the antidote to nonvirtuous activity, is the meaning of ‚Äúthe nature of the conduct of wisdom.‚Äù

original: chags pa ni mi mgo'i phreng ba yin te /
analyzed: chags pa ni mi mgo'i phreng ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúGarland of heads‚Äù means that

original: 'di ltar 'gro ba thams cad longs spyod pa'i don du phung po la sogs pa la chags shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro ba thams cad longs spyod pa'i don du phung po la sogs pa la chags shing /
translated: since all migrating beings are attached to and cling to the aggregates and so on for the purpose of enjoyment,

original: mngon par zhen par 'gyur te /üîΩde bzlog pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po de nyid kyi mgo la sogs pa'i yan lag so so tha dad par bkod pa tsam re re zhing phye na mi brtan pa nyid du de dag khong du chud pa'i phyir mgrin pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: mngon par zhen par 'gyur te / de bzlog pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po de nyid kyi mgo la sogs pa'i yan lag so so tha dad par bkod pa tsam re re zhing phye na mi brtan pa nyid du de dag khong du chud pa'i phyir mgrin pa nas brtsams te /
translated: they are attached.üîΩIn order to reverse that, the BhagavƒÅn merely arranged the individual limbs of those aggregates, such as the head, and so on, separately.

original: bus mo'i bar du me tog gi chun 'phyang dang 'dra ba'i thod pa'i phreng ba shin tu rlon pa brgyus pa ni phung po lnga /
analyzed: bus mo'i bar du me tog gi chun 'phyang dang 'dra ba'i thod pa'i phreng ba shin tu rlon pa brgyus pa ni phung po lnga /
translated: If each is analyzed, they are not stable. Since one should understand that, the garland of skulls, which is like a garland of flowers, is strung from the neck to the knees.

original: lnga lnga'i bdag nyid can dang / 'byung ba bzhi re re zhing lnga lnga'i bdag nyid can dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lnga /
analyzed: lnga lnga'i bdag nyid can dang / 'byung ba bzhi re re zhing lnga lnga'i bdag nyid can dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lnga /
translated: The fivefold nature of the four elements, the fivefold nature of each of the four elements, and the five of eye consciousness and so on.

original: byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of the bodhicitta.

original: de nyid ni rin chen padma'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni rin chen padma'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: That is the perfection of the jewel lotus,

original: rin po che ni rdo rje yin la /
analyzed: rin po che ni rdo rje yin la /
translated: the jewel is the vajra,

original: padma ni chos 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: padma ni chos 'byung ba yin te /
translated: and the lotus is the source of phenomena.

original: de gnyis rnam par sad pa las /üîΩrin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag med pa ro gcig tu skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i bdag nyid can gyi lus phung po @128a * //
analyzed: de gnyis rnam par sad pa las / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag med pa ro gcig tu skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i bdag nyid can gyi lus phung po @128a * //
translated: From the awakening of those two,üîΩthe body of the nature of great bliss that is born as one taste with Ratnasa·πÉbhava and AmitƒÅbha is the perfection of the five aggregates and so on.

original: lnga la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de'i pha rol te ngogs /üîΩphyag rgya chen po der phyin cing thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lnga la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de'i pha rol te ngogs / phyag rgya chen po der phyin cing thob pa'i phyir /
translated: That is the perfection of the jewel lotus.üîΩThe perfection is the attainment of the great seal,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: having gone to that perfection.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni mi mgo'i phreng ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni mi mgo'i phreng ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The nature of that is the garland of human heads.

original: de kho na nyid yongs su rdzogs pa'i rnam par dag pa ni ral pa /üîΩdang cod pan yin te /üîΩde kho na nyid ma lus pa gcig tu byas pa 'jig pa med par ston par byed la /
analyzed: de kho na nyid yongs su rdzogs pa'i rnam par dag pa ni ral pa / dang cod pan yin te / de kho na nyid ma lus pa gcig tu byas pa 'jig pa med par ston par byed la /
translated: The complete perfection of thatness is the locks and crown.üîΩThe locks are the two braids of profound and vast, which are twisted together, and the crown is the five families of the crossed vajra that adorns the top of the head.

original: zab pa dang rgya che ba'i skra lan bu gnyis gcus pa'i nyis sgril dang spyi bor sna tshogs rdo rje rigs lnga can gyis brgyan pa dang / ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid thod pa lnga'i tshad sor lnga pas sbras pa dang / g-yon gyi char ye shes 'od gsal ba zla bas mtshan pa /üîΩkhams gsum pa ro gcig pa'i bdag nyid mi bskyod pa'i dbang phyug dang mtshungs par chags pa'i 'khor los rgyas btab ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zab pa dang rgya che ba'i skra lan bu gnyis gcus pa'i nyis sgril dang spyi bor sna tshogs rdo rje rigs lnga can gyis brgyan pa dang / ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid thod pa lnga'i tshad sor lnga pas sbras pa dang / g-yon gyi char ye shes 'od gsal ba zla bas mtshan pa / khams gsum pa ro gcig pa'i bdag nyid mi bskyod pa'i dbang phyug dang mtshungs par chags pa'i 'khor los rgyas btab ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The five skulls, which are the measure of five finger breadths, are strung together, and the skull garland is the nature of the five pristine awarenesses.üîΩThe left side is marked with a moon, the pristine awareness of inner radiance.üîΩThe seal of passion is the seal of AkÀùhobhya, the lord of the three worlds, which is the nature of one taste.

original: sgra'i phyogs gcig mi shigs pa'i rnam par bskyod mi nus pa la brten nas /
analyzed: sgra'i phyogs gcig mi shigs pa'i rnam par bskyod mi nus pa la brten nas /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúvajra‚Äù is based on the fact that it cannot be destroyed or shaken.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i tshul du 'byung ba'i sgra mi snyan pa'i don yin na yang de'i bdag nyid ma lus pa'i byang chub kyi ngo bo skye ba'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni rna ba'i phyag rgya yin no //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i tshul du 'byung ba'i sgra mi snyan pa'i don yin na yang de'i bdag nyid ma lus pa'i byang chub kyi ngo bo skye ba'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni rna ba'i phyag rgya yin no //
translated: If it is the meaning of the word Kuru, which is derived from the root kr, to arise, in the sense of arising in a distracted manner, then the nature of the ear-seals is the cause of the arising of the essence of enlightenment in its entirety.

original: mgul rgyan ni skal ba ngan pa'i ngag gi brjod pa yongs su spang ba dang / nyin mtshan du rgyun mi 'chad par sngags zlo ba'i bdag nyid dang / sems can gdon pa'i rgyus grags pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rin po che'i bdud rtsi myong ba'i rang bzhin can yin no //
analyzed: mgul rgyan ni skal ba ngan pa'i ngag gi brjod pa yongs su spang ba dang / nyin mtshan du rgyun mi 'chad par sngags zlo ba'i bdag nyid dang / sems can gdon pa'i rgyus grags pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rin po che'i bdud rtsi myong ba'i rang bzhin can yin no //
translated: The necklace is the nature of the nectar of the jewel of perfect fame, which is the cause of the liberation of sentient beings, the nature of which is the constant recitation of the mantra day and night, and the abandonment of the speech of misfortune.

original: gdu bu ni srog gcod pa la sogs brjes su spyod pa las ldog pa'i don dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi dpal phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin can rnam par snang mdzad 'od 'phro ba'i mtshan nyid can yin no //
analyzed: gdu bu ni srog gcod pa la sogs brjes su spyod pa las ldog pa'i don dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi dpal phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin can rnam par snang mdzad 'od 'phro ba'i mtshan nyid can yin no //
translated: The bracelets are the nature of the perfect glory of the twofold accumulation of merit and wisdom, the nondual wisdom, the meaning of which is the turning away from the practice of killing and so forth, and the nature of Vairocana radiating light.

original: sku regs ni phyag rgya chen po don yod pa mo gsham ma yin pa /
analyzed: sku regs ni phyag rgya chen po don yod pa mo gsham ma yin pa /
translated: The skull is the Great Seal, which is not a barren woman,

original: 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i dngos grub kyi snod ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ro gcig pa can yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i dngos grub kyi snod ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ro gcig pa can yin no //
translated: and is the vessel of the siddhi of the result, which is the single taste of the perfection of wisdom.

original: thal ba ni ye shes kyi me 'bar bas phung po dang 'byung ba bsregs pas snang ba med pas /
analyzed: thal ba ni ye shes kyi me 'bar bas phung po dang 'byung ba bsregs pas snang ba med pas /
translated: The ashes are the absence of appearances due to the burning of the aggregates and elements by the blazing fire of wisdom.

original: shel dang 'dra bar gsal ba /
analyzed: shel dang 'dra bar gsal ba /
translated: They are clear like crystal.

original: byang chub kyi sems @128b dkar pos yongs su byugs pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa dang / nam mkha' dang / ye shes kyi snal mas se ral khar byas pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems @128b dkar pos yongs su byugs pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa dang / nam mkha' dang / ye shes kyi snal mas se ral khar byas pa yin te /
translated: They are anointed with white bodhicitta, and the thread of coemergence and space wisdom is worn as a sacred thread.

original: rab kyi mthar phyin pa thob pa dang po'i rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin can ni /
analyzed: rab kyi mthar phyin pa thob pa dang po'i rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin can ni /
translated: The ashes and the sacred thread are the nature of the first Vajradhara, who has attained the perfection of the supreme.

original: thal ba dang tshangs pa'i skud pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thal ba dang tshangs pa'i skud pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de ltar skad cig ma bcu drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / pa rol tu phyin pa bcu dang / sa bcu dang dbang phyug la sogs pa drug gi chos kyi rang bzhin can bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis bdud bzhi 'dul bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: de ltar skad cig ma bcu drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / pa rol tu phyin pa bcu dang / sa bcu dang dbang phyug la sogs pa drug gi chos kyi rang bzhin can bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis bdud bzhi 'dul bar mdzad pa /
translated: Thus, the BhagavƒÅn ≈örƒ´ Heruka has the nature of sixteen moments, thirty-seven factors of awakening, ten perfections, ten stages, six powers, and so on, and he is the one who tames the four mƒÅras, the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: bde ba chen po'i ye shes ro gcig pa 'grib pa med pa nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid can rdo rje 'chang gi sa ste /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i ye shes ro gcig pa 'grib pa med pa nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid can rdo rje 'chang gi sa ste /
translated: The stage of Vajradhara is characterized by the experience of the indivisible taste of the gnosis of great bliss.

original: bcu gsum pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The thirteenth stage is called ‚Äúpure.‚Äù

original: slob dpon shraddh'a ka ra warmmas mdzad pa /
analyzed: slob dpon shraddh'a ka ra warmmas mdzad pa /
translated: It was composed by the master ≈öraddhƒÅkaravarma.

original: he ru ka'i rnam par dag pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: he ru ka'i rnam par dag pa rdzogs so /
translated: The purification of Heruka is complete.

original: // / slob dpon de nyid dang / lo ts'a ba rin chen bzang pos bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
analyzed: // / slob dpon de nyid dang / lo ts'a ba rin chen bzang pos bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
